day1.popupDailyMessage: It's the first day of Ethicli's December Countdown!
day1.popupSocialDescription: Leah Thomas is the founder of Intersectional Environmentalist, an organization advocating for protection of people and the planet. She is very active on Twitter at @Leahtommi.

day2.popupDailyMessage: “The earth is what we all have in common.” — Wendell Berry
day2.popupSocialDescription: She’s Eco is an intersectional feminist and environmentalist blog. They are active on Twitter at @ShesEcoTweets.

day3.popupDailyMessage: “Demand quality not just in the products you buy, but in the life of the person who made it.“ — Orsola de Castro
day3.popupSocialDescription: The Considerate Consumer is a non-profit digital sustainability manual. Their pages offer more sustainable alternatives to everyday choices, explain aspects of shopping, and break down topics into easy to understand bite-sized bits! They are active on Twitter at @ConsConsumption.
day3.popupName: 7 Creative Ways to Upcycle Your Old Clothes

day4.popupDailyMessage: “Ethics is knowing the difference between what you have a right to do, and what is right to do.“ — Potter Stewart
day4.popupSocialDescription: Eco Life Choices, run by Jihea Kim, is a sustainability advocate page focusing on mindful living, slow fashion, and low-impact choices. She is active on Twitter at @KimJihea
day4.popupName: 35 Cheap & Easy DIY Compost Bins you can Build this Weekend

day5.popupDailyMessage: Remember to self care and drink lots of water!
day5.popupSocialDescription: Climate Diva is a climate communicator, model and “imperfect environmentalist” who stresses that in movements for change, striving for perfection and unrealistic expectations is counter-productive and brings us closer to climate burnout. In light of this, she guides the others on how to incorporate environmentalism into everyday life. She is active on Twitter at @ClimateDiva.
day5.popupName: How to make Veggie Stock with Kitchen Scraps

day6.popupDailyMessage: “Never limit yourself because of others' limited imagination; never limit others because of your own limited imagination.“ — Mae Jemison
day6.popupSocialDescription: Black in Marine Science is an organization that shows how integral representation and visibility of Black communities is in marine research. Their page is jam-packed with stories and advice from seasoned Black marine scientists all over the world! They are active on Twitter at @BlackinMarSci.
day6.popupName: 20 Vegetables you can Regrow from Scraps

day7.popupDailyMessage: “Diversifying the voices of sustainable fashion isn't just to elicit the cosmetic role of “inclusion,“ but also to diversify the modalities through which we understand what sustainability looks like.“ — Aditi Mayer
day7.popupSocialDescription: Aditi Mayer is a sustainable fashion blogger, photojournalist, and speaker whose work focuses on Decolonizing fashion and sustainability. She is active on Twitter at @AditiMayer
day7.popupName: How to Make an Inexpensive DIY Rain Barrel

day8.popupDailyMessage: You’re an important human being who deserves love and support.
day8.popupSocialDescription: Nicknamed the “Gangsta Gardener,” Ron Finley is famously known for his Master Class and Ted Talks on guerrilla gardening. He is an educator on building pathways for community food sovereignty, and is active on Twitter at @RonFinleyHQ.

day11.popupDailyMessage: It’s the first day of Hanukkah!

day18.popupDailyMessage: It’s the last day of Hanukkah!

day21.popupDailyMessage: It’s the Winter Solstice and Yule!
